bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Karl Jacob Belser was a Professor of Architectural Engineering, 1929-41.This collection is comprised of a 1930s set of intaglio prints and a photocopy of Karl and Wilma Belser's 1938 Christmas card that was drawn by Belser. Most of the prints are signed and dated dry point and etchings by a library staff member, however there is a strong possibility that they maybe engravings. The print themes are European architecture and bust portraits. One print is on a piece of paper that has a cutoff watermark, Michall France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains art pieces by Karl Jacob Belser, including 19 intaglio prints and one page with a pencil signature. The set of intaglio prints are from the 1930s. The collection also includes a photocopy of Karl and Wilma Belser's 1938 Christmas card that was drawn by Belser.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this collection are arranged in chronological order. Undated materials are at the beginning.
